title: Exponential Growth and Decay
text: We are able to use the formula $$y=A_0 e^{k t}$$ where $$A_0$$ is equal to the value at time zero, e is Euler’s constant, and k is a positive constant that determines the rate of growth or decay to model exponential growth or decay respectively. In the case of an exponential growth, the k value is positive while in the case of an exponential decay, the k value is negative.
speech: We are able to use the formula  y is equal to   a sub 0, e raised to the k t power  where    a sub 0  is equal to the value at time zero, e is Euler’s constant, and k is a positive constant that determines the rate of growth or decay to model exponential growth or decay respectively. In the case of an exponential growth, the k value is positive while in the case of an exponential decay, the k value is negative.

title: Proportionality
text: Observe that the expression, $$\frac{y}{A_0}$$ within the natural log expression is the proportion of bacteria count after time $$t$$. We were given that the bacteria count doubled, thus $$\frac{y}{A_0}=2$$.
speech: Observe that the expression,  fraction, y over,   a sub 0,   within the natural log expression is the proportion of bacteria count after time  t . We were given that the bacteria count doubled, thus , fraction, y over,   a sub 0,  is equal to 2 .

title: Substitution
text: We can substitute $$\frac{y}{A_0}=2$$ and $$t=20$$ to find k. What is k? Round to five decimal places.

title: Exponential Growth Model
text: Now that we've found $$A_0$$ and k, substitute them into the growth model, $$y=A_0 e^{k t}$$.
